V_arSFnriR9KXw5yikWBWg.text: Pizza, pizza, pizza!  This was our first time to the brick and mortar Driftwood Oven but we were definitely not disappointed.   The fresh crust, great sauce,  pepperoni and fresh mushrooms were fabulous topped with fresh basil- delicious.   Our server, Love, was attentive and very friendly. The other staff was also wonderful.   Purchased a fresh loaf of bread to go! Yum.  We will definitely be back!

CwQA8x5VDP7ZTB_yHPr7lg.text: I was stopped at the door before entering when reading the posted menu, I saw the prices for a 16" pizza.  Ranging from $19 to $24, this is way out of what I expected.  I am all in favor for pizza made from dough prepared 24 hours in advance (as real Neapolitan pizza is), but at most I would expect a price range of $14 to $16.  The most expensive pizza in Italy is at around 11 Euro.  Or with the latest trends of fancy flours made of non-wheat (chickpea, chestnut..), other "concept" experimental foccaccia-like creations are getting some high-paying interest.  But for thick-dough pan-dish-looking oven-cooked dough with stuff on top,  why should Pittsburgh have it priced at twice that amount? maybe it is the concept that is not working with my expectations.  If it something else that is not a pizza and is more of a full-fledged dinner entree, then I would agree at those prices.  But my mind right now is expecting an oven-baked flat-dish dough with stuff on top, aka "pizza".  It shouldn't be that expensive.  World-wide-view perception (except at 3600 block of Butler in Lawrenceville).

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. online menu

V6vRbsefCjefJz0FjsFzAA.text: This was perhaps the best dining experience I've had since returning to Pittsburgh. We were serve by a gentleman named Alistar (I HIGHLY recommend him). Everything, from the food to the service, was immaculate. I highly suggest that, if you are in the Lawrenceville area of Pittsburgh, visit Driftwood. You WILL NOT be disappointed.

fnSGRfIuTIX9p17oOunoZA.text: SO GOOD!! Thank you for bringing delicious pizza to Pittsburgh! The crust, and really all the bread served here, is phenomenal. I was blown away by the quality and taste of the cheese, and the toppings are delicious! We showed up a little after peak, and were seated promptly - our server and the host were attentive and friendly. I also appreciated all the local beer offerings.

HNCZUpUjxsXUeh6tEW3Xfw.text: Really poor sometimes snotty service, and food that isn't anything special. Why would I ever spend money here again.

8oKl2RDs2JreXZwz8slSeg.text: Though the pizza was aesthetically pleasing and the quality of ingredients were fair- it's completely overpriced for what you get. The dough is made in house, yes. However, they use a conventional oven rather than wood fired, so the burnt crust is just that- burnt. I could have done without the char. The ambiance is cute, quaint and is a solid choice if you're willing to pay a lot for pizza.

NEkOgkRglyuOrtOjEwD-SQ.text: Great pizza. We also loved the meatball appetizer. One of the better options in Pittsburgh for pizza in my opinion. Chill vibe, good prices, friendly service, and they have kombucha!

ZsYFplUs93r1NTnuokzKYg.text: I was so excited that a pizza place moved into my neighborhood, so I tried this place out on a Friday night with some friends. When we first walked in we were greeted by the host, who gave us a run down of the menu and drinks. We ordered 2 pizzas for 4 people, and some drinks. We got a number and sat down at table. Our host said the pizzas would be out in 13 minutes, but the pizzas didn't show up for about 25 minutes. We got the pepperoni pizza and a white pizza with mushrooms. The pizza was very good, but nothing crazy. I think this place is way overpriced, the cheapest pizza is about $19. I think Piccolo forno down the street has better pizza and at a better price. Cool place, but I don't think I'll go back.

RYC9Z9V_T5oVZSkoovMncw.text: Customers for life. These guys catered our wedding back in June and they (and the pizzas) could not have been more perfect. They let us choose our menu of three pizzas from a variety of options based on what was in season. The price was EXCELLENT compared to other catering options and way tastier, plus less stuffy and more appropriate for an outdoor, somewhat casual summer wedding. The guys pumped out 75 pizzas for our guests over the course of 2.5 or 3 hours (i don't remember the details exactly), and everyone loved them. We originally planned for each guest to get their own pizza, but everyone just shared in order to get a taste of each different pizza.  We also subscribed to their summer breadshare which I would recommend to anyone and will be subscribing once they start that up again.    Plus, Justin and Neil are two of the nicest guys you'll ever meet.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pizzas for wedding guests!

fmp8XSevD-zSgNPFUt32tQ.text: Excellent salad. Crust is exceptional. Fresh ingredients. A bit pricey and the sauce is nothing to write home about but it's probably the best pizza in the city.

2KuXLJ-_CVU4w4o2KNJvAQ.text: Another astonishingly good pizza from the magical Driftwood oven!  Arrived before 6 p.m. and the place quickly filled up around us.  Best pizza in town -- even the pepperoni is exceptional.  Service is very pleasant and upbeat, but the food is absolutely the star.  I not only brought out-of-town guests, I took a whole pie home because that exquisite crust (thin, flavorful, crisply blistered and well worth eating by itself), delicious sauce/cheeses and the happy scattering of fresh basil leaves are so perfectly balanced.  I'll be back again and again.  Thanks, Driftwood!

mzthpt6XhOCQ7HExL7KUsw.text: We went for a late dinner on a Saturday and were able to saddle up to the bar without a wait.  There was still a good crowd and a nice friendly atmosphere.  The pizza is pretty darn good and one pie is a good amount for 2 hungry people.  If I wasn't told that the dough was sourdough, I probably wouldn't have noticed as it's pretty subtle, but still very good.  There's a good selection of beers and the servers and staff are very friendly.

eFGyf2XVVM9GAR72Y3Dpgg.text: Probably best pizza in Pittsburgh! Was there today with my husband and son. Very friendly staff, and the best pizza I had for a while. Many options, if you didn't go there- you must! Will be back again!

8adMlDE9z8hL544XRxPkRA.text: The pizza was delicious and the decor was inviting. Neil and Justin have a really great thing going on at Driftwood and we loved dining there. We also had the vegan mushroom soup which was really good. The salted dark chocolate cookies were baked perfectly. I also appreciated the variety of non alcoholic beverages to chose from. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

ANky0Cj4CUbM6ogueBakkw.text: This is the best pizza I've ever had! The Major Tom is my favorite, but honestly, they are all delicious. The mortadella sandwich is also to-die for and the salad tastes so light and fresh. Also recommend the house rose Definitely worth the stop if you're in Pittsburgh.

Jr-3kAP9vb_uPR9IkxTRzQ.text: The pizza itself is very good - at least the part with any toppings on it. The crust was huge so i feel like i had as many bites of pure crust as i had of actual pizza.   In addition, the pizzas are overpriced by at least like 20%. If the pizza was $18 instead of $26 this would probably be a 4 star review, but between the crust issue and the price, definitely 3 star.   I was really hoping this would become be a casual weeknight place, but I'm not sure we'll be back anytime soon

omAAPzKSpX351cjPstFncA.text: Five stars for the Driftwood food truck for sure. We don't usually frequent food trucks much but my bf and I have gone out of our way to visit Roundabout Brewery on Sundays just for this pizza! Now I'm in the habit of tracking where they go to make sure we can get our fix.   We've had multiple kinds of their pizza and also bought a loaf of bread and it's all fantastic. The wood-fired oven crisps up the pizza crust perfectly and they always have a small but good selection of pizza creations they've come up with. The pizzas are sized for one person if you're looking for a meal so we usually try two kinds and share so we can try variety.    The guys running the truck are super friendly as well which just adds to the appeal! Keep up the good work (-:

i3aumhCpO6Pgz7VRXWd0yQ.text: The sourdough bread and  dipping sauces and meats are a great way to start your meal. All of the pizzas are fantastic as well. Especially the margehrita. all of the staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. If you want great pizza this is the place

imFkji0YXDUYXi7CMhbqEw.text: Had an excellent kale and mushroom pizza.  It was raining while they prepared it but stopped in time for us to eat.  The whole pie was flavorful.  It had plenty of toppings but they stopped just shy of weighing it down too much.  There were no burned spots.  The dough was significant but not to much.  It tasted a tad salty for my tastes but I notice salt more than others.  Of the half dozen pizzas I've had recently, this was by far the best.  I ate at the Millvale location on a Wednesday.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kale mushroom pizza

m0RFvTYjj12PyYfbcxRVfA.text: I adore wood-fired pizza, so I was stoked to try this food truck while they were parked at Grist House on a recent occasion that I was there. My husband and I split a margarita pizza and weren't disappointed. We were impressed with how fresh everything tasted. The sauce was super flavorful and there was plenty of fresh cheese. The crust managed to be a perfect balance of crispy and soft, although parts of it were overly blackened, which wasn't to our liking (not a huge deal though). My other complaint was that the basil was also a bit charred and there wasn't enough of it (and it's my favorite part of a margarita pizza!) So that was a bit disappointing. But overall, it was a tasty pie. It was a bit pricey at $10, but it's big enough to split with someone for lunch or a light dinner (bigger appetites, however, could probably finish one solo). I'd certainly order from them again next time I come across this truck.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita pizza

nLtfX0KDtStvh_yp5zzL1g.text: Driftwood Oven you certainly got my attention with that amazing pizza you're cranking out of your food truck wood fired oven! The ingredients they're using are all spectacular and their crust may be some of the best ever. They've definitely got their own unique flavors & perfect crust texture and I applaud what they're doing. They're also a really fun, engaging group that makes you happy to be around & support.   The Archer with spicy sausage & multiple melty cheeses was a total winner. It's a pizza I'd order repeatedly. The Bricktop with braised pork and broccolini was a great choice as a 2nd shareable option. I was impressed that the broccolini still had a nice crispy snap after the oven.   It's tough to stand out with so many pizza options but they definitely do! I see by their schedule that they're often parked outside some of Pittsburgh's wonderful breweries. An outstanding choice for a lovely adventure!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Archer with Tomato Sauce, Spicy Italian Sausage, Pecorino &amp; Mozzarella
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Bricktop with Braised Pork, Broccolini, Ricotta, Garlic, Gremolata &amp; Grana Padano

cWT34isaJjkL4lC2GUVPbg.text: This has become my new favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. The quality of the crust, flavor of the sauce, and the interesting toppings (though plain is an option) are just outstanding.   Roman style slices- the plain Margherita, red with pepperoni are my favorites. Two slices and a beer make for a great meal. Go early, it gets crowded!

oXkeCfAqmtLMzSJPOBdAJQ.text: Run, don't walk to Driftwood Oven! The service was outstanding. Our waitress gave us time to make selections and gave wonderful recommendation in addition to describing things and answering our questions. The mortadella sandwich was amazing! We highly recommended it! We got the classic pizza. It was so crispy. The mozzarella is made fresh everyday. We were early enough too to be able to get a still warm sourdough loaf to go. The food was delicious and not heavy. I loved that the restaurant lists where the ingredients come from. We cannot wait to come back and try more items in the menu!

Pn5d2FWzQ1eSI8qqyjmd7g.text: TLDR: Restaurant/staff 4 stars, pizza 3 stars. Bianca with fungi had too few toppings and the pizza dough was too thin and soggy at the center of the pie. I will definitely be back to try their other pizzas though.  Driftwood oven is a cute little restaurant with a nice family vibe. My fiancee and I discovered it while looking for an alternative to our usual pizza go to (which was closed for remodeling).  The place itself was really nice. They offered communal seating, which you will either love or hate. Personally, I like it. I figure it decreases the wait time, and you never know who you'll meet sitting next too you. I loved the overall decor, from the bench style seats and empty tomato sauce can as a pizza stand, you the mural of Pittsburgh depicted as a slice of pizza. The service was also great. The staff were attentive without being overbearing, and we didn't not wait long at all for our order to be taken.   Despite the pleasant atmosphere, the pizza we ordered did not live up to our expectations. We ordered the Bianca with fungi, which looked phenomenal from photos online. Sadly, when it got to our table there were hardly any mushrooms. There was also too much ricotta cheese which lacked flavor, and the chili flavor just added a touch of heart to each bite with out any real enhancement to the flavor profile. With so much ricotta, nothing held up the crust.  would pick a slice up, half of the toppings would slide off, leaving biting but the pizza dough that was too thin and soggy.   Despite this, the crust was delicious! Using sourdough was an unique twist, and I greatly enjoy it.  Despite my not being pleased with my pizza choice, I will be back to Driftwood. It is unfair to base an entire critique of a restaurant based on just one of their menu items.

ECjazvqMOd9UMGLRoJFPew.text: The food at Driftwood is delicious. The baba ganoush is divine, something I order every! You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas. They have seasonal pizzas which are a great celebration of the season. I highly recommend the funghi and a mason's best friend pizza .

ryKu4x_2m3Bo358tJ533Jg.text: My family of three adult children and two grandchildren had the pleasure of eating at Driftwood Oven last night. We ordered the Baba Ganoush appetizer and popcorn for the kids as we waited for all to arrive. As is usual with dips, we needed more bread in order to finish all of Baba Ganoush, so we asked for more bread, unaware until we received the bill that that additional bread was $3. The dip itself was $10. The small bowl of popcorn was $2. I think if you are spending $23 to $25 on a pizza that nickel and diming for the appetizers is unnecessary. We ordered three pizzas for dinner for the five adults. The Archer was our favorite. I thought the food and atmosphere at Driftwood was good but certainly not worth the $140 that we ended up paying for pizza and two appetizers. Alright, there were a couple of beers in there too! I do appreciate that they served locally brewed beers and cider!

mXwkPLGZekW3eCbCtEvrbQ.text: Wonderful atmosphere, I'm from Tennessee visiting my son.  He knew these young men, when they had a food truck and an oven and drifted.  So awesome to see local success!  Best salad ever, meatballs spicy yummy!  Oh yes and the pizza, it was great!  Just different and good enough to make it!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6ho-GyysYiD2i7gMlKv6ww.text: This place is amazing. It's very small, but great pizza and atmosphere! My husband and i split a pizza, and we had trouble deciding on which one so the bartender helped us. They have a TON of local beers which was awesome to try, and just hang out while we waited for our food. We went before a penguins game, and it wasn't too packed but sat at the bar area. Definitely worth trying. The dough of the pizza is the best, definitely worth the price. We will be coming back for sure!

mE88V833j9AP1qBGHCYkMg.text: The BEST pizza in Pittsburgh and quite possibly the world.  They use top notch ingredients.  The sourdough crust is impeccable.  I've been following them since they started as a food truck.  Not only is it a good restaurant, but they are good people.  They are truly appreciative of the community and those who helped them get where they are today.  I always recommend this place to friends.  Its a great spot to go with a group or just to stop in for a slice.

63YdPuPWxy-T1oVptnHGXQ.text: Incredible bread and pizza.  Incredible.  That is the 5 stars.  They are slightly overpriced, bit I would be too for the hype.  That's cool.  Their clientele suck.  I'm glad they have the the press they have, but as a local I'm super annoyed at the idiots trying to find parking and hanging around this area to wait an hour or more for dinner on a weekday.  The suburbs love this place because it was in magazines, I get it.    Very conflicted.   Amazing pizza, but probably too popular for it's own good.     Stick with a pick up order.

v_czAWGX5-PadmkdZ2BOrw.text: Wow. After reading all of the glowing Yelp reviews I went to this place expecting some seriously next level pizza. Imagine my disappointment when what we got was more like very greasy, very thick cardboard with very little flavor.  We ordered two different kinds of pizza - the "red top" and the margarita. They tasted almost exactly the same. They were both covered in puddles of oil. The crust was thick and hard throughout, making eating more like work than a reward.  If you want to compete in the awesome pizza category at this price point in this neighborhood, you've simply got to do better. I can't see any reason I would ever return here with Piccolo right up the block.

C8Mc9Yf4wkYJRySBsJMThw.text: i went here tonight with my husband  , 12 y/o step daughter and 5 year old son who is special needs, when we arrived i asked right away if they were "child friendly" and the response was yes, (some establishments turn us away when they see our son with us) but they did not, we felt welcome. Justin the waiter was top notch, he addressed me by name and the pizza-service was great. we will definately be back here again,. THANK YOU DRIFTWOOD!

qlV6RRS5Jn3KqzVx5a5meg.text: Went in for dinner on a Saturday night. We were a party of 2, so we ordered at the counter and were seated immediately after. We were lucky to have gone on a nice day when the windows were open. The restaurant itself is nicely set up with comfortable spacing and furniture. The host (I think one of the owners) was extremely friendly and welcoming and explained the menu when we asked. Pizza is never really something I crave, but this place has certainly changed that. Excellent sourdough crust and toppings, a perfect blend of ingredients. We ordered one red pizza with sausage and added hot peppers and one white funghi pizza, and they were both amazing. We will definitely be back.

W9MkJO3V2HuAQHSfBo-LfQ.text: Good pizza, But seriously not worth the price!  Waiters should be packing.  Other brick oven pizza for much less $$$ around town.  Seriously folks lower your prices, unless the rich folk is all you care about.

0bGHETq2WgxfpyEyhyc4IQ.text: What else is there to say about these guys other than the pizza is spectacular and the owners are genuinely amazing? When eating the product of any restaurant, it's clear from the beginning when someone is completely devoted to, and passionate about, their craft. Driftwood is the rule.   The sourdough crust is a showstopper. It has an incredible chewy texture, crispy (not crunchy) exterior and just the best flavor. Even when I eat at some of the best pie places in Brooklyn I find myself wishing the crust was sourdough now!  The toppings / combinations are streamlined and smart. No need to customize - just trust them. The ingredients are high quality and locally sourced.   Though we'll miss these guys pulling their oven around to some of the best local breweries, we couldn't be happier to have them as a permanent fixture in the neighborhood. Here's to many successful years!

EkxPDC3y69CE0hwp--aE8w.text: This place is amazing! The crust is to die for. The sausage was killer. Very trendy, cool atmosphere. Staff is super friendly...Justin the owner is the man! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great pizza experience in the Burg!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

d8EbJa1Zy9lldUKF5jrjjw.text: This place is great! I could argue that their pizza is as good as Don Giovanni's in NYC, but that would sound like crazy talk and you'd never believe me. It is comparable though and is now my favorite thin crust pizza place in Pittsburgh. You will not be disappointed. Nom nom nom. *The mural is by Joe Mruk. Had to look it up. So awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pfuFowhsZl57yCCARcsWFw.text: This place has a great atmosphere and really cool vibe to it, though the food definitely didn't live up to my expectations. Although the pizza is beyond visually appealing, it definitely lacks flavor. I ordered the vegan potato slice and it was beautiful, but tasted like a piece of bread w pieces of potato on it, slathered in oil. The white pizza we ordered was also very visually appealing, but lacked flavor - and left a lemon after taste. I have the same critique for everything else we ordered as well - baba ganoush, salad, popcorn, veggie pizza, and another pie (i forget the name)....all very tasteless but pretty to look at. The cider beer was actually 10/10 though so that's a plus. I would not recommend this restaurant to be honest, it's very over priced for the food you receive. I recommend this place to anyone that just wants to take a pic of a nice looking piece of pizza lol. Def wish we didn't blow $132 here

AkLJyCwJF6MRBRPQOOKzwA.text: Overall an awesome experience. Very friendly staff and the pizza was great too! One the owners even came out to chat and thank us for stopping in. I will definitely be back soon!

2MqHVRXhd6eBbeH6dHDGrQ.text: Visited the fine crew of Driftwood while at Roundabout Brewing.  The team there was very friendly and engaging.  They have a limited set of pizza options, but the options they had all looked fantastic with plenty of  fresh ingredients.    My drinking crew for the day enjoyed the Archer and the Bricktop pizzas.  Excellent crisp crust on the outside, not too charred, but chewy and tasty on the inside.  The Bricktop came with braised pork (yes please!) and broccolini.  Because I am the epitome of health, I considered having Broccolini on my pizza a serving of vegetables.  Both pizzas were quite good with the Archer getting my #1 vote.  Since they are a food truck, look up there schedule and find them, you will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bricktop Pizza
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Archer!

BhZerexuC6tNYtl1z8-2Tg.text: They call me a drifter...  as I mozied on through Lawrenceville I came across this new pizza joint called Driftwood Pizza.   I tried a piece of this artisan pizza made with sour dough bread and fresh ingredients. You can order a pie or sicilian style single pieces.  Don't... Like... It  The ingredients are fresh but there is very little flavor and I don't like the sour aftertaste of the dough.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UG3m1K_Sxle2UcN0gKottQ.text: Truly loved this spot; one of the better pizzas I've had (and I lived in NYC for 14 years!!) and I live in Chicago now.  Came last night at 7:30 (a Wednesday), and very easily got a table for 3. Service was great! We were kind of taken care of by everyone on the floor which was nice because everyone was attentive and it felt like we got to know everyone.   There is beer and wine, including wine on tap!  Ordered the bagaghanoush (deliciousssssss! Loved the pickled red onion on top) and two pizzas. Let's put it this way: I have leftovers, it's 9am and I'm about to go eat them.   I also love the Pittsburgh vibe, from the wall mural to the Pirates hat on one of the (I believe?) chefs. It's like home inside and I adore that.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9b-nbTXGS88T9pCBgRiuaA.text: We stopped in on Wednesday evening for dinner around 7:30. There was a wait for a table, but if we opted for a communal table, then we could be seated. Not a problem, we're hungry, let's not get hangry.  We looked over the drafts list and saw some delightful beers on tap and in cans. Draft is way better and Driftwood has more local options on tap than cans. Hubs get a Flock and I get a How's Business? Sour, which is very sour.   We ordered the from the daily special and got the spigariello and sausage. The ingredients were tasty and offered a good spice and garlic flavor. What makes the pizza is the sourdough flavor. It's good, but not to the level of Slivers or Cheese Board (but then again the climate in the Bay Area makes sourdough more pronounced). It's still very good and the thin style is perfect.  There is only a 16 inch option, so come with someone. The couple next to us didn't know how much to order and wanted to try different pizzas and ended up ordering two. It was quite a bit of pizza. One pie had eight slices. Frame of reference, I had two slices, Hubs was hungry and had four.   The cookies compelled us, so we wrapped up the evening each with a chocolate sea salt cookie. Pretty tasty, but it was in a fridge. My guess is that they stored it there so it wouldn't melt on a hot day. Fine, a bit disappointing.  Service was friendly, but there was only one wait person and it was crowded for the first 30-45 minutes we were there. As such, it was a bit of a wait.

5M8Od-DuIjNdGWztMqRlmg.text: This place rules. They pizza is dope af and I want to eat here all the time. I've gone in and sat at bar but I also will be doing takeout since I live nearby. 1 pizza is 6 slices and 2 slices is enough for one person. It says 1 pizza per 2 people but that's nuts and come hungry if that's you. No judgement, it's delicious. There were 3 of us and we got 2 pizzas because it's too hard to choose just 1 and we had a lot to take home. But I'm happy this place exists. Thanks DO

LQc6zQ-wLHs-g8gO_47XfQ.text: Service was excellent.  Very courteous and attentive.  Pizza not that good.  Almost no sauce.  Toppings were sparse.  Pizza tasted very very salty.  Super expensive for what I would say was a mediocre pizza at best.  $25 for a large 16" with one topping.  Far better pizza elsewhere.    Baba Ganoush was also not that good.  Bread was excellent.    Wouldn't go back anytime soon.

HFTWgipwO-r8IVROs03fYw.text: Pro Tip: Chrissy Teigen ate here Wednesday night. What did she order? Meatballs, kale blazer salad, classic pizza and the early spring pizza. She also says you must get an ice cream sandwich.  The pepperoni pizza and mixed lettuce salad that I personally experienced was phenomenal. I had the  cookies and cream ice cream sandwich and well, that was delicious too.   You won't find any ranch for dipping your pie here but ask for some caesar if you need a little something like me.  Service was fantastic. Food was fantastic. It's one of those places where you walk in to a packed house - and you just know it's going to be something special.   10/10. The couple raving about Chrissy Tiegen just eating here made it a lasting memory for me. Too cool!

fxlTuPwkc74wlPJtt6cX4w.text: Context: I am an amateur bread baker.  I came here tonight, while I was learning about the thriving 6 year old sourdough culture I was immediately intrigued. My starter had just died a tragic death at the age of 6 months. I had to take a chance and see if I could get my hands on some. I was directed to a nice man named Neil who happily got me back into the bread making game.   THANKS NEIL!!!!   You made me a REALLY happy baker!

ofvyUUgT2CuafeCeiNH0Xg.text: One of my favorite pizzas. Just amazing. The crust is on it's own level. The sourdough is unique but not overpowering. It has just the right amount of chew. Everything is fresh and the culinary background of the chef comes through in the ingredient use and meticulousness. Driftwood is elevated above the standard pizza joint but still authentic and comfortable.

-vGZaGAfJznk98_W_G2iAA.text: Our first time here and wow !!!!! The Bianca is delicious! The baba ghanoush was hard to get used to, coming from a middle eastern background I'm a little critical of our food! i didn't really taste much eggplant in it. But overall was good! I had the Maggie's farm cocktail and it was good!! My fiance had the dancing gnome and it was yummy! We will def be back !

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty wall art
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bianca Pizza

XsZ2m6cYMztMF2scYO_JXg.text: Nice little shop with friendly employees.  Stopped in for a piece.  The crust is sour dough and when baked gets very crisp and thick.  Fresh and tasty toppings.  You can build your own or choose from a couple of well crafted styles of red or white.  There are a few beers and wines available.  And some Leona's ice cream sandwich for a sweet finish.

Q2J0lEERUSmneMF5QSZj5Q.text: UPDATE 6/13: Justin, one of the owners, and I exchanged a number of emails over this experience and he was nothing but receptive and apologetic. After fully understanding the situation, Justin sought to make amends and make up for our experience. His kindness, ownership of the situation, and True sincerity was impressive. This positive experience definitely put Driftwood back on the 'good restaurant list' from handling a bad experience with the appropriate kindness and apologetic attitude; I do think they want to learn from mistakes and be the best restaurant they can be.

yc117DL4X_lD-YJ4H2P_GA.text: My friend wanted to go here on her birthday so we tried it out. The staff here is pretty nice, they recommended things that we both loved. If you're a picky eater, you might feel intimidated by the Pizza's with fancy toppings- but don't worry- they're tasty! They open later in the evening too. We went right as they opened and tables were filling up quick! For a salad (that we split), a  16" pizza and 3 drinks- our total was under $60. I'll definitely make a point to go back!

otArgWwCMjr9ABHgdkWYTg.text: A food truck pizza that opened a restaurant? Me think not. I was wrong... Service was excellent and the pizza....wow. For sure the best pizza in PGH. Will be coming back often. Thanks for working so hard to make something so wonderful. Oh, and the meatballs are awesome too!

WXt8leAwv__B7gqynXFGww.text: During a recent brewery hop visit we stopped at the Grist House and found Driftwood Oven had set up shop and was serving up some hot pies.  After a day of beer sampling, we were getting hungry and decided to look at their menu.   My husband loves pizza.  I on the other hand am usually unimpressed with most places. Actually, I would usually opt to eat well just about anything else besides pizza.  However, the smell from the makeshift kitchen was enticing and we were in need of some grub.    We decided on the Archer pie.  The best part about this pie was how well they cooked the fresh crust.  It had a perfect texture.  Not doughy and not too charred.  The ingredients were all very fresh and the sauce was quite delicious.   The size is more in line of a personal pizza, but one can share for a light dinner or appetizer.  Great beer with great food is a win win in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Archer

AJLyZoHjBViFX5BYCEdEmg.text: They had a table for three open but told many parties of two they had to wait 45 minutes for a table.  Not sure why you'd leave a table open when people want to buy your food.  Food is good but overpriced for what it is.

mojPN7fQO_ZiftQf38rNpw.text: Love everything about this place. First fell in love with their pie when they were just a mobile truck years ago. The two guys that run this spot are just so incredibly friendly, especially Justin. They truly care about their customers and want to be sure you have the best dining experience. Their pies are very big and definitely enough for two people to share. Tried the mushroom soup the other week, wow was that so incredibly delicious and packed with SO much flavor. So hearty and unique, definitely give it a try. For a vegan pie I love just doing a simple marinara with shiitake mushrooms, but last time Justin recommended the customer vegan pie the kitchen was whipping up. Toppings included caramelized onions, butternut squash, charred kale, shiitake mushrooms, and black radish, all over their house marinara - wowow, it looked so beautiful, almost too pretty to eat. They also have a great wine and local beer selection. Apps, salads, and sandwiches. Love the red checkered table cloths and the cheese mural of downtown Pittsburgh on the back wall is so epic. We are lucky this duo found a brick and mortar, looking forward to my next time back.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vegan pie ! SO delicious. red sauce, caramelized onions, butternut squash, charred kale, black radish...delish!
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fr5ApS7xSRYTG-iHfzmmtA.text: Really liked this place. Smells amazing right when you walk in. We sat at the bar, out waitress was great. They have cans of beer and boxed wine, reasonably priced. The pizza was excellent, we had the "Young Garlic". My only thing about this place is the price of the pizzas. While our pizza was really good, it was $26. A little steep if you ask me. Will definitely be back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#34;Young Garlic&#34;

nxLDy3Gy0HwnGwM1hJ31mQ.text: Had 2 pizza, baba ganoush, meatballs and everything was awesome. I'll definitely eat here again.

8k4NYgIPS6S-SoisLRBygQ.text: First time here and only complaint was the wait time! Fantastic food and atmosphere. We ordered the meatballs, which is 4 meatballs and 3 slices of toast so I would recommend it for a couple or group of 3. We also ordered 2 pizzas that were fantastic, the Archer and Mason's Best Friend. We will definitely be back!

_3aFT_InXL-Lwy37M9laPA.text: Favorite pizza in Pittsburgh!   As a pizza lover new to Pittsburgh, I had serious concerns about how I would satisfy my pizza cravings based on subpar local favorites. Driftwood is a godsend!   The sourdough crust is amazing. The toppings taste fresh and seem thoughtfully paired. After a few visits, I've tried about 5 pizzas, all of which were good, but nothing has rivaled The Archer.   The baba ganoush appetizer is excellent. Pro tip: Save any extra you may have for dipping your pizza crust.  The service is awesome. Our waitress was very attentive and the rest of the staff was friendly and good humored.  Reservations aren't currently accepted, but you can put your name on the list and have a drink in the waiting area or a bar nearby (though there's no system to alert you that your table is ready). We had a large party (8) during peak on Friday night and only had to wait ~40 min. It was well worth it.

MJrCzt-xkL0OrNSr_PunGw.text: Okay, I know I'm not the first person to go here simply because Chrissy Tiegen tweeted about it last week after her trip to Pittsburgh. But yinz, she wasn't wrong!!   I'll start by saying make a reservation or be prepared to wait. It's very small inside and they require your whole party to be present in order to be seated. They did serve us drinks while we waited though which was greatly appreciated.   After a half hour wait, we sat down and quickly ordered the pizza rolls and two pizzas. We ordered the Bianca and one with spicy Italian sausage. I can't say enough about how good they were! The crust is extra thin, the flavor packs through every bite. It was too good to even remember to snap a pic!  If you're in Lawrenceville, I can't stress enough that you should check out this new place on the block!

yPEITIBbq06HbQZz5HEawg.text: Have been wanting to try this place ever since Chrissy Teigen tweeted how good their pizza was. My friend and I came on a Wednesday night and we were able to get a table right away. We had the baba ganoush and the Lieutenant Dan. They ended up coming out together even though we were hoping to start with the baba ganoush. The baba ganoush was nice and creamy and had the perfect amount of smokiness. It was served with a delicious bread but definitely made it a heavier appetizer. The pizza was huge! It was a ricotta pie with chili oil, sorpressata, and basil. Their dough is great! It is nice and thin but still holds the pizza. I didn't really taste the heat of the chili oil, but the pizza was still delicious. Would love to come back and try their other pizzas! Prices for the pizzas are on the higher side, but we both had substantial leftovers so it was fine. Overall, a great place in Lawrenceville to grab some pizza.

XjW6V-P_qu_5CFqfnQjcOA.text: Superior pizza with a superior pizza experience. Driftwood is a step up in the pizza world. Pies are a bit more expensive, but that's because each one is carefully crafted - from the delicious sourdough crust to the house-made or otherwise locally-sourced toppings, everything on the menu is a perfect combination.  They have a nice beer list, but the place tends to get packed. I like to call in my order ahead and pick it up if I'm with a larger group, but sometimes I don't mind putting my name in and grabbing a drink somewhere else on Butler Street while I wait.

UhHCvinAtdh61E5JAjmESA.text: Dropped in with a group of friends for a fun night out enjoying some deliciously fired up artisanal pizzas! I went in a voracious, sober young lad and came out with a sophisticated palate for great pizza! (and a few pounds heavier)  Things I liked: - a great selection of flavors. I greatly appreciate that they're fairly simple, well thought out flavors and also very light pizzas. - pizzas as a whole were great! - service is wonderful. Our server was very patient, kind and had a great sense of humor! - I like that there's ample table space and that the restaurant doesn't feel too crowded. The pizzas are placed on an elevated surface to generate that sense of openness (great thinking!)  Things I didn't like: - would have appreciated a wider range of beers, perhaps a little of the entire spectrum. However, overall I think our party of 8 was very much satisfied! - The pizza flavors worked very well and had an overall nice balance of savory, aromatics, and saltiness. However, the crust was a bit bland and dry. Perhaps adding a bit more olive oil would help or altering the ratio of crust to each pizza, but what do I know I just eat...  Overall, a very positive experience for artisanal pizzas, I am looking forward to trying their other flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margherita pizza with spicy pulled meatballs. Absolutely delicious!
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smokey,smooth Baba Ganoush with amazing bread! Someone&#39;s a happy camper!
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. She&#39;s got her priorities right

SnJLNh0BYeFSE2eJihQLKQ.text: My parents have been wanting to try this place out for some time now. They first had it when they started off as a food truck and they loved it! So we decided to make a visit.  It was a Saturday night and I could tell that the food was going to be good because it was about a 45-50 minute wait!!! Which ok because the food was sooo worth it! Luckily they're next to an antique shop, so you can wonder in there while you're waiting.   For dinner, we started off with the meatballs. Wow. For a person that doesn't really like meatballs, I absolutely loved these! Would happily order them again.   As for the Pizza, that was a hard decision! So many great ones to choose from. We decided to go for the Archer and the Mason's Best Friend. Both were great, though I preferred the Best Friend one. It tasted so fresh.  This is a very cute and cosy restaurant. I like that it's a local business and that they support businesses in PA by buying products from local farms.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The meatballs
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The archer
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Mason&#39;s Best Friend

V9hkwy0G9gELP2A56YqLKg.text: I wish I could give Driftwood more than 5 stars. Not just for their fantastic and creative pies but also for their bread share, beer menu full of tasty local brews and wonderful staff. Eating in their cozy dining room truly makes you feel at home. Keep up the great work!

nR3XWDIs-ZrDGe7jnEeiXg.text: I'm impressed! Driftwood is now one of my favorite pizzas in Pittsburgh! I tried the Classic and it was fantastic! For how simple it was, the taste of those few ingredients together and the texture of the crust really stood out to me. Sauce was perfect and the crust was thin and crispy, yet not too crispy. Everything about that pie was so well-balanced. In addition to great tasting pizza, they had a really nice draft and beer selection.   Space-wise, it's a bit small, but who cares when you can get some bomb pizza and beer. I cannot wait to come back!

P9a4-j01Zu1WpctfCPCPQw.text: My sibling and I stopped here for dinner while visiting Pittsburgh for a show later that evening. As avid pizza lovers (and having both worked in pizza shops for years before), we loved Driftwood! It's definitely for thin-crust fans though, as it's a traditional thin crust style. So if that's not your style, maybe order one of their sandwiches (they sound delicious!) or go with a salad. We split the four cheese pie, and loved how the honey complimented the white base so well. (Wasn't expecting that!) I added some pepper flakes to mine and it was perfectly spicy and sweet. Great local beer/cider selection well, and the shop had an intimate, homey but modern feel to it. Overall a great experience, and we'll definitely be stopping by the next time we're in Pittsburgh!

0s8GZDQdn9fp9JQFOy1pzg.text: Incredible pizza. I ordered the pocket and was disappointed to find it was only sprinkled with cheese after sampling some of the cheese covered individual slices. Our server doesn't like to see anyone disappointed so she didn't charge me and got me a meat slice! She'd already helped me out with a couple tastings when I couldn't decide on a beer.  The people next to me got a full sized pepperoni and I was drooling in my seat.  Gotta love the service and the food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meat slice is heaven

MVtEuVESl37l-ZQKEJlhAg.text: A friend and I have heard so many good things about driftwood oven so we decided to give it a try. Went in around 6 on a Friday and a party of 2 only had a 15 minute wait. We took a walk around the block for that time since the bar was full and it is a pretty small location. Once we were seated we decided on some beer and the meatball appetizer to start. The meatballs were delicious! They were slightly spicy and the sauce with the toast dipped into it was bomb. We decided on the Italian sausage pizza and thoroughly enjoyed it. One thing I wish they had more of was the sweet peppers, but no problem because the crust was the real star here. Thin sourdough crust with a wood fire bake. I normally don't eat the crust on the pizza, but this one I did! Overall, slightly pricey but not too bad, we each had 2 canned beers and split pizza and appetizers for under 30

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatball appetizer
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Italian sausage pizza

5KsrrEZlcMuRr_ztTsW3cg.text: As a pizza enthusiast, I can confidently say that this place makes the best pizza in town! The vibe, ingredients, hospitality and most importantly the taste is out of this world!!  Also, I can't speak highly enough for Justin. Such a pleasant but also a professional owner! Thanks for always taking good care of us!

v7Ck0zq0pV38xBKEEWXEMw.text: Great pizza! and enjoy the whole atmosphere of this place is outstanding.   Just wish they would open earlier on Saturdays and Sundays

l_jmUu4r2lExOKM5y8xS6Q.text: I've had the Driftwood pizzas at various events the city, so I knew I had to make way to their brick n mortar shop in Lawrenceville! I love this spot. Their spot is awesome! There is a pizza/Pittsburgh mural on the wall. It feels very homey and relaxed.   We headed to Driftwood around 6pm on Wednesday evening. To my surprise - there were plenty of tables available. They must have recently changed they way that you order - because we were seated first and then ordered. We didn't have stand at the counter.   They have beer and wine on tap. I ordered a Dancing Gnome beer - but they lots of local brews available.   To start - we ordered the babaghanoush with the house made sourdough bread. It was very good. You gotta order it!   For our entrees- we shared the 16in Bianca Funghi pizza and the Classic Red pizza. The Bianca pizza was incredible- you gotta order it!! The classic pizza was just okay - we would try a different pizza instead next time!   Unfortunately, the wait staff took a long time getting our bill - but overall I enjoyed my night out at Driftwood.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

E52KC61-kgVVOnR2M7JD1Q.text: Awesome place for pizza !! Had the 4 cheese pizza and they drizzle honey which was amazing!! Tuscan bread so so good!! Texture of the bread is great!!! Will be back to try other things on the menu

6MrwJSOvh7lYfejXEeYPsA.text: So we finally made our way back to Driftwood at their new spot in Butler Ave in Larryville.  We'll start with the food: 4.5 stars The pizza - I can't say it is just as delicious as before, because it's different. You can see by the pictures that the pizza is cooked differently. That being said, this pizza is delicious in a different way. The crust is still unique because it it sour dough and the toppings are first class. I really enjoyed the red top slices. This crust differs from their standard pie as the crust is thicker. I wish I worked closer because I could definitely see myself grabbing a slice or two :) for lunch. The bread - yassss! Thick crusted, "burnt" tasting, soft center. Yum. My mouth is watering. I was also surprised now much I liked the baba dipping sauce. It is much sweeter and has more texture than I am used to (huge fan of pita land), but unique and tasty.  And finally - the service: 3 stars  I am not a huge fan of the set up. The ordering service reminds me of gaucho. Order at the counter and pray that there is some where to sit. You also have to continue to go back to the bar/hostess stand to order more drinks. It's complicated. It did not bother my husband but I would prefer to have a server. That being said, I have no idea if it will stay this way?   Regardless, I love their pizza so I'll be back - maybe even this weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Jf7k1iEg0g8lpadAIPoZKA.text: Really good pizza.. super fresh ingredients. I got takeout so not a ton to speak of but the gentleman who rang me up was very pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7Adb2yK5unKXFHSei1_EVQ.text: Pizza was just about perfect. Chewy, charred crust, great ingredients, fantastic atmosphere. Will definitely be returning with friends in tow.   Also, Moira served us at the bar and she was perfectly attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. Thanks!

gSjDAHTZBTvQ4kfPavAhXg.text: I visited Driftwood Oven at the recommendation of a friend and loved it.  The restaurant was packed, so I sat at the bar, where the full menu is served.  I was impressed with the draft list, which features a variety of quality local beers.  The ambience was fun, but not so loud that I could still have an easy conversation with the people next to me.  I started with the mixed greens salad, which was delicious and featured a nice variety of flavors and textures.  I then had the meatball pizza, which was very tasty.  Overall, I think this is a great place to visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatball pizza
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mixed greens salad

Vf0emvh6m_8iN8EyJGPV9g.text: Okay, parking was 100% a pain, and the wait for our food was antagonizing. The food was fantastic. The baba Ghanoush was very different, but amazing. The Veggie pizza was really good, but not as many veggies as I would have liked. For dessert, we got the ice cream sandwich cookies and cream on a chocolate wafer. It was fantastic Overall, it was pretty good but nothing amazing. The food was good, service was eh, and the parking was tough. Wouldn't mind going here, but not running back

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Restaurant
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cookies Cream ice cream sandwich

umnvmKK6vAupgq7S8oSMnQ.text: I've been wanting to try Driftwood since I saw postings on IG when they had a truck at the Lawrenceville days. I had some time before an appointment near by and stopped in. I was happy that they had pizza by the slice available!  I had originally was planning to get an app but this worked out even better. I had a glass of the Rose with a slice of Margherita which was delicious. The dough is baked directly on the hearth!  I definitely will be going back again the next time I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rUDCXrGz7bvIQcLxko0ZaA.text: Driftwood Oven is my favorite restaurant. I even moved across the country and still think, talk, dream about it regularly. Without fail, every visit provides friendly and excellent service. Definitely take the recommendations from your server as Driftwood is always trying something interesting and delicious - whether it be the rotating pizza specials or a new starter. Every dish I've ordered here has been amazing and it has pushed me outside of my comfort zone. The peach and corn pizza special this summer was something I would not think to try and it is now one of my favorites! My husband and I try to get to Driftwood as much as we can, for any occasion, with as many people as we can.   My go-to, date night order here starts with the baba ghanoush. It is a great way to try their delicious sourdough bread, experience an interesting mix of flavors, and feel slightly healthy while doing so! Next, split a mixed greens salad. It is seriously an amazing, flavorful salad that lets you taste how fresh their ingredients are. Finally, split a pie - I highly recommend going for a rotating special. A Mason's Best Friend or Major Tom are always goods picks, too. Last, split a Leona's ice cream sandwich or a salted dark chocolate cookie or two!

AkX7oW2eT_ExrseYpjLn_g.text: Finally made it to Driftwood last weekend. (Better late than never!) It certainly lived up to the hype, with a homey pizzeria vibe coupled with upscale ingredients and presentation. Rocky IV was on tv instead of some lame sports game, which was a nice touch. We went later on a Sunday as service was winding down and only waited 25 minutes for a table. I suggest doing that if possible, since it seems like things could get pretty crowded during peak times.   My boyfriend had the meatball pizza and I got the Italian hoagie. It was hands-down one of the best hoagies I've ever had, and the homemade sourdough roll was the perfect thickness without being too crunchy. He raved about the pizza and devoured most of it on-site. One pizza with an appetizer or salad would likely be enough to share, but due to my dairy allergy we couldn't go that route. (They offer cheese-less vegan pizzas FYI.) I can't wait to come back and try a rotating Roman-style vegan slice and maybe get that hoagie again. Driftwood is certainly worth the attention it's been getting lately!

ieOGYQZhf2_hwZ2naDltgQ.text: Definitely a must drop in. We have enjoyed dining in and taken out, the sourdough crust alone is worth the wait. Then they add the toppings, yowzer.  We eaten here a few times, making iur way through the menu. The setting is great, the staff always friendly and everyone always looks to be having a good time.

mWMwxSa6zV1TZ7eY5KbOlQ.text: I have loved Driftwood since their early days as a food truck. I would seek them out. I would go to events just because they would be there. I thought that was the greatest thing ever...until they opened this brick and mortar location. Holy mozzarella you guys, dare I say the pizza has gotten better? I've been to this location a handful of times and have never, ever been let down.  The flavors from the sauce and toppings are just mind-blowing. Little tip-the food is so good that the restaurant is often times packed and there is a wait to get in. I'm telling you it's worth every minute of the wait.

qvAVqmv-bzE61rdrgrmfAQ.text: Friday nights call for pizza so it was rightfully so I ended up at Driftwood oven. I like that it's a small restaurant and that even when crowded, you still can hear the people sitting at your table so you don't resort to shouting.   The Bianca Funghi was good. Definitely needed more flavor to it. I wish I could have opted for a red sauce/sausage pizza but it was a Friday in lent, I'm a lax Catholic, I had to uphold some religious obligations.   I had to make room for dessert once I saw Leona's ice cream sandwiches were available. I went for the coffee snickerdoodle which was amazing. Honestly having one ice cream sandwich to yourself after two slices of pizza makes you feel absolutely stuffed but hey you got to treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bianca Funghi

Z6xRdWr11srVXZUUIHUjcQ.text: A bad start with a great ending! I understand this place is busy because they have great food! You can't put 3 people at a 6 person table. But aside from a bit of a wait this place is completely worth it!! From the crust to the cheese and sauce all aspects of this pie are on point! Keep up the good  work!

JDvhnztnIio6nkBsviMKMg.text: Really good pizza!  We had Mason's best friend pizza and it was delicious!  The hot peppers had a great sweet brine and taste paired well with the mortadella.  Yum!  The beer selection is ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mason&#39;s best friend

w12WZHSafTCe9uymUp28Kw.text: Really enjoyed our experience at driftwood oven! Their space is super cute and fits right in with the rest that Lawrenceville has to offer. We walked in and were seated right away on a weeknight at 6pm.... but they got much busier as we had our meal.   They have a great selection of local beers which are served in mason jars. Drinks in mason jars are automatically more enjoyable   Their pizza was really good and they had a wide variety of options. The pizza comes in one size and is good to spit with one or two other people depending on how hungry you are! They are each around $20 give or take a few bucks. They are a little pricier than your typically pizza, but the toppings are worth it!  We also had the kale Caesar salad.... and I loved it!! Super simple but just want I want when I think of a fresh and tasty Caesar    Each of the staff members that we interacted with were super friendly and helpful!! In particular, our waitress happily took the time to explain some of the pizzas to us and gave suggestions based on our preferences. I really appreciated that because it doesn't always happen!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

EOA0SwhZ29hyDBSbfX8joA.text: I always recommend Driftwood Oven to people looking for artisan-style pizzas. It's my favorite "fancy" pizza in the 'Burgh (I am categorizing classic take-out pizza separately because there is a difference between sit-down pizza and take-out IMO!) and I have shamelessly eaten way too much of it for my own good.   It's *always* busy at Driftwood, but it's definitely worth the wait. The flavor combos for some pies might scare away picky eaters by the description, but trust me when I say they know what they're doing (looking at you, Bianca with the honey sauce).   It's a little expensive, but it's artisan pizza. You can expect to pay about $30 for a pie with tip, but you WILL have tasty leftovers. DEFINITELY try Driftwood ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bianca
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bianca (...again &#39;cause it&#39;s that good!)

w1eV1NiKsSv6zINIY6uiwQ.text: As good as the reviews indicate.  Excellent pizza and great service.  Cool atmosphere and a good selection of local craft beers.  Finally got in!!  It's tough in the weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Good local craft selection
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ice cream sandwich
Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Awesome pizza

kcm-6GIV1SmgmCHYZOYZLg.text: Really liked the pizza. Really did not like the salad. Really liked the bread. Really like the carb choices...LOL!!  We ordered the white pizza with the honey. DELICIOUS. However, it was tricky navigating oil from honey on the pizza. It was probably too rich of a dish for me. But, really delicious.  The bread is really good too. I didn't see a lot of veggie options. Had a lot of pork selections-however, we don't eat pork.  Recommend it, but not running back.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

G45CVyRlSPwFlaukfdtxuA.text: This is my favorite pizza place in Pittsburgh. The pizza was awesome and the service was exceptional. I've walked past this restaurant serval times and it is always packed but somehow we got a table for two with no wait at 8pm on a Saturday. The servers were super quick with our orders. We asked to try their house red. It was very fruity and a little sour - really nice wine - but not for me. We ordered the bianca funghi pie and asked for them to go light on the cheese and white sauce. When they brought our pizza out, they restated our order back to us, bianca funghi with light cheese and white sauce, and it was great to hear this. The pizza was amazing - maybe the best in Pittsburgh. The crust is crispy and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. Putting chili oil on pizza is genius! For dessert we got the chocolate toffee cookies. They were 2 for $2, so why not? They were also amazing, and almost brownie-like topped with flaky salt. The pizza was a little expensive $25 isn't cheap, and with two drinks and a tip we spent over $50. Driftwood Oven is worth it, however, it is a great trendy establishment with amazing pizza and great service. We will be back!

AiX2XjWwc-rjObmQVEKpkQ.text: I probably can't say much that hasn't already been said. This place is really good. I refuse to use the overused term "amazIng" which is so popular these days and my wife kept repeating it in between bites. But I really enjoyed it! We had the eggplant parm pizza and also a sweet sausage, mushrooms and onion pizza. They were both delicious but I enjoyed the latter much more.  Four of us did an impressive job crushing them both. I have to say the beer prices were very reasonable too. $2.50-$6.50 ea. What else can I say? The service was fine, the staff was friendly. The order came out a bit slowly but it was worth the wait. All of that said I would recommend and return.

eh5carFdgOwdB613khRzDQ.text: Last night was our monthly friends dinner held at Driftwood. It came highly recommended by a member of our party.   First - it's far enough down on Butler you'll find parking. I arrived at 6:30 and parked right outside.   Second - your entire party must be present or they won't seat you. Our party was not present. They have a bar, but it was really full so we opted to have a drink down the street. It was really busy when we returned but we were still seated promptly.   Third - the food/drink obviously! We started drinks. They have beers, ciders and wines. No cocktail menu. I had a wine on tap and we ordered two beers for others at the table. We started with the Pepperoni pockets. Our server recommended two to share. Two was plenty! We also order the Sargent Tom pizza - think olive oil, garlic, prosciutto, ricotta. Both were very good and the perfect amount of food.   I can't say it's the best pizza I've had in Pittsburgh,  but worth a visit for sure.

csUH40LcdYvnE-i4JhEWaw.text: I'll put this number 2 pizza spot in Pittsburgh for me so far. It is a thin pizza style with variety of toppings. The decor is very cool with the tomato sauce can in the middle of the table. I would def go back to try other toppings since the broccoli taste is overpowered all other flavors with what I got this time. The price is a little but pricey, $24 for 6-8 slices.  The food took a while to come out so don't come super hungry like I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rapini e Salsiccia

Y4IM7Du6dWnafjem3Akh6A.text: We decided to head down Lawrenceville to try out a "new" pizza joint and picked Driftwood Oven. While parking is off-the-street and at a premium, you can find parking on the back streets if you are lucky.   The overall decor has the cozy feeling of home with the aromas of sweet oven baked pizza. Walking into the place, the first thing you feast your eyes on is the brick walls and wood backed bar. The smiling host/hostess at the front is very cheerful along with the waiters.   The beer selection is locally brewed craft beers and some of the staple mainstream beers (ie. Coors Light, Yuengling, etc). Seating wasn't bad at all as we came at 2pm on a Sunday and were seated right away.   We ordered the pepperoni pocket for an appetizer and it was stuffed full with pepperoni and cheese. It was perfectly seasoned and the inside of the pocket was cooked but not over-cooked.  We then ordered the Archer Pizza, which is their spicy sausage pizza. It had a pretty decent kick to it and the sausage was the ground up type not the big chunks. The crust was crispy and not burnt and the pizza itself was cooked to perfection. We couldn't even eat it all.  Overall: Price was a little high for the food at $22 for a 12 cut but I will gladly pay more for great food and Driftwood definitely has phenomenal food. Will gladly recommend this place to anyone and come back.  P.S. --- Also there is a local brewery within walking distance to get drinks afterwards!

iOeBH5j_Vv5TgH2uea32xA.text: I've clearly been on a pizza kick these past few days, and let me tell you... Driftwood was phenomenal. Their sourdough pizza crust was something that clearly sets them apart.   We arrived at Driftwood around 7:00 on a Friday evening, and waited at the bar for a table. Their bar was stocked with several local craft beers, all served in mason jars. We were seated before we could finish our drinks, which was pretty impressive for a Friday night.   We decided on a Caesar salad and a pepperoni pizza (with pickled peppers and mushrooms) to split. Both were amazing and came out relatively quickly. I was pretty shocked by the size of their pizzas; we ended up taking half home, which turned into a great snack the following day.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pepperoni pizza with added pickled peppers and mushrooms

Wn9VCdXl7y4Lx_e4KYz1Jg.text: Great hospitality and wonderful food. Their pizzas start with amazing crusts. They are like an artisan bread, yeasty and hand crafted. But the toppings, cheese and herbs put them over the top.   The owner was friendly and genuinely nice. I could tell he puts great pride in the food, and that pride is well deserved.  I didn't taste the Baba Ganoush, however, the customer to my right ordered it and it looked impressive.   There's a nice selection of craft beers and cider.   You can't go wrong eating here.

VYhkJseno2iXviIY2vTBaw.text: This is the third time I've been here. I don't know how to put this any other way other than to say that their pizza is perfect. I had the sweet sausage pizza with no mozzarella and I'm telling you it was amazing!!! I'm allergic to dairy otherwise I'd pile on the mozzarella! Service was also excellent and the Smooth Sailing drink with Maggie's Farm white rum. I can't wait to come back

GxAfglSZIVRtUQRBCgClmQ.text: Incredible pizza! Been here many times and am always satisfied. A little expensive but always worth It. Bring friends and split a couple of pizza! They have some drinks you can get. And the tables are so cute! And love that the pizza sits on tomato cans! You can tell they use quality ingredients on everything and every pizza I've had has been nothing but great. The workers are nice and exploring Butler street is always great after. Fun pizza shop on a cute street. Make a weekend afternoon great here! Highly recommend!!!

CY84sSzJ9oz6PQ3ZmBz1Yg.text: As a frequent visitor to Pittsburgh, I am always interested in finding new restaurants, and my local coworker Zavo turned me on to this one. On this trip, I was given the recommendation to try the Driftwood oven. This is a mobile pizza station with a large wood-fired pizza/bread oven that's mounted on a trailer, and they travel from location to location in the Pittsburgh area, serving up some of the best pizza I've ever had. I tried their Margarita Pizza: it was wonderful! . Look them up at driftwoodoven.com for their next scheduled location. It's worth the drive!

cz9UKPpT6_O6z-lByUAhYQ.text: their pizza is amazing! fungi bianca is my incredible (wirh shitake ) we also got the pepperoni pocket which was a combo of a panini and a calzone- as a person who loves calzones and can never find someone to split one with- this is incredible! the meatballs were also so flavorful and delicious! AND they have gender neutral bathrooms ()!  srsly get yr bootie here already!

l55FQ0F8AhnBT1l1Agoccw.text: Best pizza in Pittsburgh! Quality ingredients, always delicious toppings. This food truck can be found at various locations in Pittsburgh, check out their schedule on Facebook. Great service!

8Gvj7KWmdmGxaYhPzQ1fAA.text: Really good, fresh pizza.  I tried it at the Garfield Night Market over the summer.  I need to stalk their social media more so I can have the pizza again. It was delicious.   I loved that each pizza is made to order.  They have containers of the dough all weighed out and then prep whichever of their interesting menu pizzas you finally decided on. They have meat and veggie options. Around $10 for a pizza which comfortably feeds one. I got the basic margarita pizza. The crust was crispy on the bottom, and slightly chewy. The basil was slightly burnt on the edges from the heat of the oven, but I'm not sure how that would be prevented. It didn't taste bad, just some of the basil flaked off.  I thought the brick oven was really cool. It's a little different than most food trucks, which I loved.  Hope to see them around again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Driftwood Oven - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool brick oven they haul around on a trailer.

RKdinMQZ5QTAQ9PfvQsM-A.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant on our way to another one that we were familiar with. The sourdough pizza sign caught our eye. It turned out to be an excellent choice for dinner. We were warmly greeted by one of the owners, who explained the history of the place to us and checked on us all evening. The house salad was one of the best we've ever had, and the pizza was delicious. We took home one of their loaves of sourdough bread, which was as close as you can get to real San Francisco sourdough bread. All in all, a wonderful experience.

l7Qo1gyvuGEcmY5XtUB7EA.text: For the NYC pizza fans in the group this is a "go to" in the Pittsburgh area.  The Pizza was nicely done, crispy and thin crust.  The toppings were upscaled. Fun, super casual place for a crowd.  The menu was limiting but if you are aiming for pizza - this is the place. Wait staff was accompanying for our group. The kitchen could tone down the garlic a little as it tended to drown out the other great things going on with the pizza.

23r7APbKUJ3QftI3Ou8j2g.text: We completely stumbled onto DWO, after realizing Gaucho and Piccolo Forno we're closed on Sundays. We were lucky to do so because, this is really great pizza place!  The best part about the burgeoning Pittsburgh food scene is that we are have a group of people pouring their heart and soul into the food they serve. Driftwood Oven lives up to that ethos.  The service was very attentive and the food was served in a timely fashion. My wife and I had a very hangry set of pre-teen daughters with us at the time and even they were happy with the pace of the service. We had a great time and will be back.

C0_b3KahadqSZfn0bpdPVw.text: House made sourdough bread with baba ganoush was one of the best things I've had in quite some time.  Had the archer with sweet and spicy peppers for the main and was excellent as well.  Simple and allowed the fresh ingredients to stand out.  Service was great too.  Awesome experience.

Mt3KZBsHCyqB9SeXBPWZ9g.text: This place is... fine. In the couple of times I've had it, the crust tends to come out a bit charred which I'm not crazy about. Aside from that, the flavors are good and fresh; however, I find their pizza to be pretty overpriced. I will sometimes get their pizza in the future if they're at a brewery and it's the only food option, but I would not seek it out. I don't understand all of the hype.

LGFKjcwYL5lOCUkK7pUjVg.text: Driftwood Oven is AMAZING!!  Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is hands down, the BEST!  I live out of state but am a frequent traveler to Pittsburgh and will definitely make a stop at Driftwood a ritual!!

m1Im8BUT4v_R2POqo_8YPQ.text: We (2 adults and 2 kids) ate here a couple weekends ago and had a great experience. Restaurant  has a warm/modern/pizza joint feel about it. The vibe is calm but not dull. You order as you enter, then take a seat and full service from there. I like this because it really expedites things and forces you to decide what you want before you sit down. They were happy to make small changes in the pizzas for us. Service is very friendly and prompt. Salad was excellent and perfectly executed (rare these days); pizza is definitely in my top 3 in the city. Crisp, chewy crust, fresh toppings and just enough sauce. They have two draft beers (we liked them both) and a variety of bottled beers and a few wine choices. My only suggestion...please move closer to Regent Square!

Rv42_OLlgt2Sy5N3Bs6rIA.text: I had this pizza at grist house brewery and it was extremely solid pizza. I cant image somebody making a better pizza out of a drive away wood fired oven. The guys who made the pizza's were extremely chill and the pizza's they made were True Neapolitan pizza. I had the margherita and it was apparent they made their crust and mozzarella in house. The crust was simply amazing, although a little soggy in the middle. Overall it was an extremely well done pie.

sc8WSf9C-kZ9fm2pXRIKAg.text: We had the McKees pizza. It had banana peppers, mushrooms, sopressetta, and Pecorino Romano (I think).  The pizza was good. I actually love brick oven pizzas so I was a huge fan. It had just a little too much burnt crust for my liking but it should be expected using an oven like that. I wish there were more banana peppers too because I love them!    I wish I could have tried a few more but I guess that is next time is for!! All in all, it was a super great experience and the staff was so kind to us and our dog which made me fall in love with them immediately. If I run into their food truck again, I'll definitely try another one!

6wEege8BlfZ7UyGjZ4g13w.text: These guys kick ass!  Killer pizzas and they're quick!  We caught up with them at Grist House Brewing, and they filled our bellies with quality groceries!  Thanks!

P7lVtsPFg_a8yPuvdeJ8dQ.text: Rockstar experience.    While it had been my original intention to take my Margarita pizza to go, my plan had been thwarted after I had taken that first bite.    I don't know how they did it, but between the sauce, the dough, and the rest of their ingredients and trade secrets, that was easily the best pizza that I had eaten in a LONG time.    Do yourself a favor... follow them on Facebook and make it a point to GO.  You are going to very impressed.

RPjp37m6sE9_ywsG7FYHjg.text: Sundays for us mean eating out (usually at Birmingham Bridge Tavern in the Southside for their pulled pork sundays) and usually enjoying some beer at a local brewery. We generally go to Voodoo in Homestead but we had been seeing the Driftwood Oven outside of Roundabout  and decide to switch it us and go there. We ordered a pizza with sausage and red sauce. It was delicious. The dough was cooked perfectly and consistent. I did wish it was brought to us a little warmer but overall I enjoyed the pizza. I also had a tasty shaved cheese on top that I think was asiago. I also comment on portion size and I thought this was a perfect lunch option. It was pretty small but shareable. The two of us had two, decently sized slices. I'm not sure that everyone would agree with the value (It was a little bit over $10) but I found it to be worth the quality. Overall, I was really happy to get to enjoy both the brewery and the pizza at once! I'm sure we will stop back the next time we want to stay close to our house for a little bit of Sunday fun!

Gpt_Lcqs9cnPPZOQr_0yQw.text: What a unique idea for a food truck! These guys hit the mark spot on with a delicious crust and amazing toppings! We had the Margherita pizza, and were extremely satisfied!!  We shared the pizza with some patrons in our salon, and everyone was raving about it!  The truck was parked in the Southside and Riverpark Commons, and we work in a salon across the street. I went out to see what they were making & to chat a bit with them, and the smell was absolutely intoxicating. I had every intention to go back around noon to try the pizza; however, our day filled in with appointments, and I didn't have a chance to walk back over. One of the guys actually came over with a pizza for us! It was such a nice gesture, and he wouldn't accept money. I can honestly say that Driftwood Oven made our day. It is amazing to have nice things happen to you!   We wish you guys all the success in the world!!

JdsbXGGfZOOyA_3wSi7yrw.text: Delicious pizza! Tried three of them: the Margherita, Market, and Toadstool. All of them were delicious and had distinct flavors; the Market pizza was my favorite! The pizza size was just right for a meal, though could be shared between two people if both eat little. Definitely give them a try. I'm already looking forward to their next visit!
